bbc-british-broadcasting-corporation.name: Tim Davie
bbc-british-broadcasting-corporation.bio: Appointed BBC Director-General in 2020, previously led BBC Studios and served as CEO of BBC Worldwide.

bbc-british-broadcasting-corporation.name: David Attenborough
bbc-british-broadcasting-corporation.bio: Legendary BBC broadcaster and natural historian whose career with the corporation spans over seven decades.

bbc-british-broadcasting-corporation.name: John Reith
bbc-british-broadcasting-corporation.bio: First Director-General of the BBC who established the corporation's public service ethos and editorial independence.

bbc-british-broadcasting-corporation.name: Samir Shah
bbc-british-broadcasting-corporation.bio: Media executive appointed BBC Chairman in 2024, with decades of experience in British broadcasting.

deepmind.name: Demis Hassabis
deepmind.bio: Nobel Prize-winning AI researcher who co-founded DeepMind in 2010 and led the development of AlphaFold and AlphaGo.

deepmind.name: Shane Legg
deepmind.bio: New Zealand-born AI researcher who co-founded DeepMind and serves as its Chief AGI Scientist at Google DeepMind.

deepmind.name: Mustafa Suleyman
deepmind.bio: British AI entrepreneur who co-founded DeepMind before leaving to found Inflection AI and later joining Microsoft as CEO of AI.

deepmind.name: Koray Kavukcuoglu
deepmind.bio: Deep learning researcher who joined DeepMind early and rose to lead its core research efforts as Vice President of Research.

revolut.name: Nikolay Storonsky
revolut.bio: Russian-born British entrepreneur who co-founded Revolut in 2015, growing it into one of Europe's most valuable fintech companies.

revolut.name: Vlad Yatsenko
revolut.bio: Ukrainian-born technologist who co-founded Revolut and built its core banking technology platform as Chief Technology Officer.

revolut.name: Francesca Carlesi
revolut.bio: Former investment banker appointed CEO of Revolut's UK operations, overseeing its push to secure a full UK banking licence.

revolut.name: Martin Gilbert
revolut.bio: Veteran asset management executive and co-founder of Aberdeen Asset Management who became chairman of Revolut.

unilever.name: Hein Schumacher
unilever.bio: Dutch businessman who became Unilever CEO in 2023, previously serving as CEO of Royal FrieslandCampina.

unilever.name: William Lever
unilever.bio: British industrialist who founded Lever Brothers in 1885, which later merged with Margarine Unie to form Unilever in 1929.

unilever.name: Paul Polman
unilever.bio: Dutch businessman who led Unilever as CEO from 2009 to 2019, championing sustainable business practices globally.

unilever.name: Nils Andersen
unilever.bio: Danish business executive who has served as Chairman of Unilever, previously heading A.P. Moller-Maersk.

board-of-deputies-of-british-jews.name: Phil Rosenberg
board-of-deputies-of-british-jews.bio: Elected President of the Board of Deputies of British Jews in 2024, the oldest Jewish communal organisation in the UK.

board-of-deputies-of-british-jews.name: Marie van der Zyl
board-of-deputies-of-british-jews.bio: Barrister who served as President of the Board of Deputies from 2018 to 2024, advocating against antisemitism.

board-of-deputies-of-british-jews.name: Michael Wegier
board-of-deputies-of-british-jews.bio: Served as Chief Executive of the Board of Deputies, managing the organisation's day-to-day operations and communal advocacy.

board-of-deputies-of-british-jews.name: Moses Montefiore
board-of-deputies-of-british-jews.bio: Renowned Victorian-era Jewish philanthropist and leader who served as President of the Board of Deputies in the 19th century.

jw3.name: Raymond Simonson
jw3.bio: Founding CEO of JW3 who led the creation and development of London's flagship Jewish community centre in Finchley Road.

jw3.name: Dame Vivien Duffield
jw3.bio: British philanthropist whose generous support through the Clore Duffield Foundation was instrumental in establishing JW3.

jw3.name: Michael Goldstein
jw3.bio: Community leader who served as chairman of JW3, guiding the centre's strategic development and community programming.

imperial-war-museum-holocaust-exhibition.name: Suzanne Bardgett
imperial-war-museum-holocaust-exhibition.role: Head of Holocaust and WWII Exhibitions
imperial-war-museum-holocaust-exhibition.bio: Led the creation of the Imperial War Museum's permanent Holocaust Exhibition, which opened in 2000 and was redesigned in 2024.

imperial-war-museum-holocaust-exhibition.name: Diane Lees
imperial-war-museum-holocaust-exhibition.bio: Served as Director-General of Imperial War Museums, overseeing the institution including its landmark Holocaust galleries.

imperial-war-museum-holocaust-exhibition.name: James Smith
imperial-war-museum-holocaust-exhibition.bio: Educator and organiser involved in developing the museum's Holocaust education programmes and exhibition content.

wiener-holocaust-library.name: Alfred Wiener
wiener-holocaust-library.bio: German-Jewish scholar and activist who founded the Wiener Library in 1933, making it the world's oldest Holocaust memorial institution.

wiener-holocaust-library.name: Toby Simpson
wiener-holocaust-library.bio: Served as Director of the Wiener Holocaust Library, overseeing its collections and public engagement programmes in London.

wiener-holocaust-library.name: Ben Barkow
wiener-holocaust-library.bio: Led the Wiener Holocaust Library for many years, expanding its archives and establishing it as a key research institution.

wiener-holocaust-library.name: Barbara Sheridan
wiener-holocaust-library.bio: Community leader who served as Chair of Trustees of the Wiener Holocaust Library, supporting its educational mission.

n-m-rothschild-sons.name: Nathan Mayer Rothschild
n-m-rothschild-sons.bio: German-born British banker who founded N M Rothschild & Sons in London in 1811, building it into a leading merchant bank.

n-m-rothschild-sons.name: Alexandre de Rothschild
n-m-rothschild-sons.bio: French member of the Rothschild family who leads the wider Rothschild & Co group which encompasses the London bank.

n-m-rothschild-sons.name: Robert Leitão
n-m-rothschild-sons.bio: Senior banker who served as Managing Partner of Rothschild & Co's Global Advisory division in London.

n-m-rothschild-sons.name: Jacob Rothschild
n-m-rothschild-sons.bio: 4th Baron Rothschild who served as chairman of the bank before founding J. Rothschild Assurance Group and leading philanthropic endeavours.

the-rothschild-foundation.name: Jacob Rothschild
the-rothschild-foundation.bio: 4th Baron Rothschild who established The Rothschild Foundation to support arts, heritage, education and the environment.

the-rothschild-foundation.name: Hannah Rothschild
the-rothschild-foundation.bio: British filmmaker and author who succeeded her father as Chair of The Rothschild Foundation, also chairing the National Gallery.

the-rothschild-foundation.name: Fabia Bromovsky
the-rothschild-foundation.bio: Served as Executive Director of The Rothschild Foundation, managing its grantmaking and cultural heritage programmes.

campaign-against-antisemitism.name: Gideon Falter
campaign-against-antisemitism.bio: British activist who founded the Campaign Against Antisemitism in 2014 to combat rising antisemitism in the UK through legal and educational means.

campaign-against-antisemitism.name: Stephen Silverman
campaign-against-antisemitism.bio: Leads investigative and enforcement efforts at CAA, pursuing legal cases against antisemitic hate crime and discrimination.

campaign-against-antisemitism.name: Joe Glasman
campaign-against-antisemitism.role: Head of Political and Government Investigations
campaign-against-antisemitism.bio: Oversees political monitoring and research at the Campaign Against Antisemitism, analysing antisemitism across political spheres.

manchester-jewish-museum.name: Max Dunbar
manchester-jewish-museum.bio: Led Manchester Jewish Museum through its major redevelopment and reopening in 2021, expanding its galleries and community spaces.

manchester-jewish-museum.name: Alyson Moses
manchester-jewish-museum.bio: Community leader who served as Chair of Trustees overseeing the museum's governance and heritage preservation mission.

manchester-jewish-museum.name: Edward Misrahi
manchester-jewish-museum.bio: Longtime supporter and former Chair of Manchester Jewish Museum who helped guide the institution during its transformation.

pears-foundation.name: Trevor Pears
pears-foundation.bio: British philanthropist who leads the Pears Foundation, supporting social and community initiatives across the UK and internationally.

pears-foundation.name: Mark Pears
pears-foundation.bio: Member of the Pears family and trustee of the foundation, part of the property dynasty behind the William Pears Group.

pears-foundation.name: David Pears
pears-foundation.bio: Patriarch of the Pears family who co-founded the Pears Foundation to channel the family's charitable giving.

pears-foundation.name: Charles Keidan
pears-foundation.bio: Served as Director of the Pears Foundation, guiding its strategy in education, identity and social enterprise.

arcadia-group-topshop-philip-green.name: Philip Green
arcadia-group-topshop-philip-green.bio: British billionaire who built the Arcadia retail empire including Topshop, BHS and other high street brands before its collapse in 2020.

arcadia-group-topshop-philip-green.name: Tina Green
arcadia-group-topshop-philip-green.bio: Wife of Philip Green and Monaco-based beneficial owner of Arcadia Group's parent company, Taveta Investments.

arcadia-group-topshop-philip-green.name: Ian Grabiner
arcadia-group-topshop-philip-green.bio: Longtime executive who served as CEO of Arcadia Group, managing its portfolio of fashion retail brands.

arcadia-group-topshop-philip-green.name: Kate Moss
arcadia-group-topshop-philip-green.bio: Supermodel who had a high-profile design collaboration with Topshop, becoming closely associated with the brand's cultural influence.

jewish-leadership-council.name: Jonathan Goldstein
jewish-leadership-council.bio: Property executive and communal leader who has served as Chairman of the Jewish Leadership Council, the UK's senior Jewish communal body.

jewish-leadership-council.name: Claudia Mendoza
jewish-leadership-council.bio: Journalist and communal professional who served as Chief Executive of the Jewish Leadership Council.

jewish-leadership-council.name: Mick Davis
jewish-leadership-council.bio: South African-born mining executive who chaired the Jewish Leadership Council and served as CEO of the Conservative Party.

kindertransport-association-uk.name: Ruth Barnett
kindertransport-association-uk.bio: Kindertransport survivor and author who became a leading educator about the Kindertransport experience and refugee issues.

kindertransport-association-uk.name: Nicholas Winton
kindertransport-association-uk.bio: British humanitarian who organised the rescue of 669 mostly Jewish children from Czechoslovakia on the Kindertransport in 1939.

kindertransport-association-uk.name: Bertha Leverton
kindertransport-association-uk.bio: Kindertransport survivor who organised the landmark 1989 reunion of Kinder and founded the Reunion of Kindertransport organisation.

kindertransport-association-uk.name: Alf Dubs
kindertransport-association-uk.bio: Czech-born British politician and Labour peer who arrived on the Kindertransport and later championed refugee children's rights in Parliament.

office-of-the-chief-rabbi.name: Ephraim Mirvis
office-of-the-chief-rabbi.bio: South African-born rabbi serving as the Chief Rabbi of the United Hebrew Congregations of the Commonwealth since 2013.

office-of-the-chief-rabbi.name: Jonathan Sacks
office-of-the-chief-rabbi.bio: Renowned philosopher and theologian who served as Chief Rabbi from 1991 to 2013, authoring numerous influential books on faith and morality.

office-of-the-chief-rabbi.name: Immanuel Jakobovits
office-of-the-chief-rabbi.bio: Pioneering Chief Rabbi from 1967 to 1991 who founded the field of Jewish medical ethics and was elevated to the House of Lords.

bevis-marks-synagogue.name: Shalom Morris
bevis-marks-synagogue.bio: Served as rabbi of Bevis Marks Synagogue, the oldest synagogue in Britain, built in 1701 by the Spanish and Portuguese Jewish community.

bevis-marks-synagogue.name: Moses Gaster
bevis-marks-synagogue.bio: Romanian-born scholar who served as Haham (chief rabbi) of the Sephardi community in England from 1887 to 1918.

bevis-marks-synagogue.name: Joseph Dweck
bevis-marks-synagogue.role: Senior Rabbi of S&P Sephardi Community
bevis-marks-synagogue.bio: American-born rabbi who serves as Senior Rabbi of the S&P Sephardi Community of the UK, which includes Bevis Marks Synagogue.

plus500.name: David Zruia
plus500.bio: Israeli businessman who has served as CEO of Plus500, the London-listed online trading platform founded in Israel.

plus500.name: Alon Gonen
plus500.bio: Israeli entrepreneur who co-founded Plus500 in 2008, helping develop its contracts-for-difference trading technology.

plus500.name: Gal Haber
plus500.bio: Co-founder who served as CEO of Plus500 during its growth phase and London Stock Exchange listing.

plus500.name: Penelope Mayfield
plus500.bio: Experienced financial services professional serving as Non-Executive Chair of Plus500's board of directors.

tottenham-hotspur-f-c.name: Daniel Levy
tottenham-hotspur-f-c.bio: British businessman who has served as Chairman of Tottenham Hotspur since 2001, overseeing the construction of the club's new stadium.

tottenham-hotspur-f-c.name: Joe Lewis
tottenham-hotspur-f-c.bio: British billionaire and majority owner of Tottenham Hotspur through his ENIC International investment company.

tottenham-hotspur-f-c.name: Ange Postecoglou
tottenham-hotspur-f-c.bio: Australian football manager who was appointed head coach of Tottenham Hotspur in 2023 after success at Celtic.

tottenham-hotspur-f-c.name: Bill Nicholson
tottenham-hotspur-f-c.bio: Tottenham's most iconic manager who led the club to the first league and cup double of the 20th century in 1961.

world-jewish-relief.name: Paul Anticoni
world-jewish-relief.bio: Leads World Jewish Relief as CEO, overseeing its humanitarian and development programmes in Eastern Europe and globally.

world-jewish-relief.name: Maurice Helfgott
world-jewish-relief.bio: British communal leader serving as Chairman of World Jewish Relief, the UK Jewish community's humanitarian agency founded in 1933.

world-jewish-relief.name: Otto Schiff
world-jewish-relief.bio: German-born British financier who founded the organisation in 1933 to aid Jewish refugees fleeing Nazi persecution.

the-rothschild-archive.name: Melanie Aspey
the-rothschild-archive.bio: Archivist who served as Director of The Rothschild Archive, managing the family's vast collection of historical business and personal records.

the-rothschild-archive.name: Victor Gray
the-rothschild-archive.bio: Archivist and historian who previously directed The Rothschild Archive, establishing its scholarly research programmes.

the-rothschild-archive.name: Emma Rothschild
the-rothschild-archive.bio: Harvard economic historian and member of the Rothschild family who has supported the archive's academic and research mission.

chelsea-football-club-abramovich-era.name: Roman Abramovich
chelsea-football-club-abramovich-era.bio: Russian-Israeli billionaire who owned Chelsea FC from 2003 to 2022, investing heavily and winning five Premier League titles and two Champions League trophies.

chelsea-football-club-abramovich-era.name: José Mourinho
chelsea-football-club-abramovich-era.bio: Portuguese manager who led Chelsea to back-to-back Premier League titles in 2005 and 2006 during Abramovich's transformative ownership.

chelsea-football-club-abramovich-era.name: Bruce Buck
chelsea-football-club-abramovich-era.bio: American lawyer who served as Chelsea's chairman throughout most of the Abramovich era from 2003 to 2022.

chelsea-football-club-abramovich-era.name: Marina Granovskaia
chelsea-football-club-abramovich-era.bio: Russian-Canadian executive who served as Chelsea's powerful transfer negotiator and director under Abramovich's ownership.

dangoor-family-exilarch-s-foundation.name: Naim Dangoor
dangoor-family-exilarch-s-foundation.bio: Iraqi-born British businessman and philanthropist who founded the Exilarch's Foundation, claiming descent from the ancient Jewish Exilarchs of Babylon.

dangoor-family-exilarch-s-foundation.name: David Dangoor
dangoor-family-exilarch-s-foundation.bio: British property developer and communal leader who chairs the Exilarch's Foundation, continuing his father Naim's philanthropic legacy.

dangoor-family-exilarch-s-foundation.name: Richard Dangoor
dangoor-family-exilarch-s-foundation.bio: Member of the Dangoor family who serves as trustee of the Exilarch's Foundation, supporting education and cultural heritage programmes.
